text: Irish House of Lords was the upper chamber of the Irish Parliament from its creation in the thirteenth century to its abolition in 1800â€“1801. It was made up of the barons and clergy of the island. After the reformation the clergy in the Lords came from the Church of Ireland. Category:History of Ireland Category:Parliaments Category:13th-century establishments in Europe Category:1800s disestablishments in Europe
title: Irish House of Lords
